sources.full: Honourable Heroes; Higher CR Humanoids for Encounters

trait.name: Stoic Devotion
entries: The Afeera has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Fortune's Favor
entries: The first time the Afeera successfully hits another creature with a melee attack on a turn, they gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Leaping Gazelle
entries: The Afeera may make a single melee attack with their mace as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Speeding Comet
entries: As a bonus action, the Afeera can move up to 20 feet toward a hostile creature that they can see.

trait.name: Khassaki Kick
entries: The Afeera may replace their first mace attack on their turn for a shield bash or their second mace attack on their turn for an unarmed strike. On a hit, in addition to the damage, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

If the unarmed strike hits, the Afeera may make one mace attack against the same target as a bonus action; if the shield bash attack hits, the Afeera may make one mace attack against the same target with advantage as a bonus action.

trait.name: Astro Flip
entries: The Afeera can move 5 feet as part of a melee attack they make on their turn without using any of their speed. The Afeera can't move this way if their movement speed is 0, they are {@condition prone}, or are otherwise unable to move.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Afeera makes two mace attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Gravity's Pull {@recharge 5}
entries: The Afeera chooses one Large or smaller creature it can see within 5 feet, the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. Large creatures have advantage on the saving throw; Small or smaller creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw.

On a failed save the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, they swap places with the Afeera, are {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and are knocked {@condition prone}; the Afeera then makes one mace attack against the creature with advantage.

action.name: Orbiting Shield {@recharge}
entries: The Afeera throws their shield at one creature they can see within 30 feet, making a ranged attack roll. On a hit the creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d6+4}) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

The shield then ricochets and the Afeera may repeat the attack against another creature within 10 feet of the the previous target; it may repeat this way a number of times up to the Afeera's Dexterity modifier.
When the attack misses, or ricochets the maximum number of times, the shield returns to the Afeera's arm.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Afeera adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Afeera must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Dual Wielder
entries: The Aramusha gains a +1 bonus to their AC while they wield a separate melee weapon in each hand (included above), they can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons they are wielding aren't light, and they can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when they would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Aaramusha can use their bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Rock Steady
entries: The Aramusha cannot be knocked {@condition prone} by non-magical means. They also have advantage on saving throws against spells or other effects that would force them to move.

trait.name: Rushing Wind
entries: If the Aramusha moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then makes a melee attack against it on the same turn, the Aramusha gains advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Tempest
entries: If the Aramusha hits a creature with all four of their attacks on a turn, they may make one additional attack with their dual katanas against the same creature as a bonus action. If the additional attack hits, it is considered a critical hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Aramusha makes four melee attacks, two with their dual katanas and two with their katana in alternating order. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dual Katanas
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Aramusha throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Blade Blockade
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Aramusha, the Aramusha may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Aramusha succeeds they may do one of the following options against the creature and the creature's triggering attack is wasted:

items: {@b {@i Ring the Bell:}} The Aramusha makes a katana attack with advantage. On a hit the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.
{@b {@i Twin Vipers:}} The Aramusha makes a dual katanas attack with advantage.
{@b {@i Push Back Kick:}} The Aramusha makes an unarmed strike. On a hit the target is pushed back 5 feet and knocked {@condition prone}.

entries: Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Aramusha adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Aramusha must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the Archer can deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the Archer that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Berserker can double their speed until the end of their turn. Once they use this trait, they can't use it again until they move 0 feet on one of their turns.

trait.name: Spin Chop
entries: The Berserker may make a single melee attack with their handaxe as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Dance of the Paired Blades
entries: If the Berserker successfully hits with all of their melee attacks on their turn, they may use a bonus action to make two additional melee attacks with advantage.
If all five attacks on a turn hit, the fifth attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

trait.name: Head Slicer
entries: If the Berserker successfully hits with their first handaxe attack on a turn, the attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Berserker makes three melee attacks with their handaxes. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Berserker places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Berserker throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Berserker's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Brute Force
entries: If a melee attack misses the Berserker after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Berserker may make one unarmed strike with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

reaction.name: Skilled Slash
entries: The Berserker adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Berserker must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the triggering attack misses, the Berserker may make one Handaxe attack against the creature that made the attack.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The Black Prior has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Bulwark Stance
entries: The Black Prior can use their action to assume a defensive stance. Whilst in this stance the Black Prior's movement is halved, they gain +3 to their AC and may make one melee attack as a bonus action. Additionally the Black Prior regains 7 hit points at the start of their turn. The Black Prior can exit this stance as a bonus action on their turn; they automatically exit this stance after they take the attack action, multiattack action, use the Bulwark Counter reaction or if they are {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition stunned} or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Harsh Requiem
entries: If the Black Prior successfully hits a creature with an attack on their turn, they gain advantage on their next attack against that creature until the end of their turn.

trait.name: Tenebris!
entries: Once per turn, the Black Prior may make an attack with their shield bash instead of their longsword. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Tower Shield
entries: Whilst wielding this shield, if the Black Prior is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, they can use their reaction to take no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, interposing the shield between themselves and the source of the effect.
Additionally if the Black Prior moves no more than half their movement speed on their turn, they count as being in half cover against ranged attacks whilst wielding this shield.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Black Prior makes two longsword attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Umbral Shelter {@recharge 5}
entries: The Black Prior may use their action to choose any number of allied creatures within 30 feet. The chosen creatures gain 12 ({@dice 2d8 + 3}) temporary hit points.

reaction.name: Bulwark Counter
entries: While in Bulwark Stance, as a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Black Prior, the Black Prior may flip the creature over them. If the creature is Large or smaller they must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be moved to within 5ft. of the Black Prior on the opposite side to where they were, be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}; the Black Prior then makes one melee attack against the creature with advantage. Large creatures have advantage on the saving throw; Small or smaller creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: While not in Bulwark Stance, as a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Black Prior, the Black Prior may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Black Prior succeeds they may make a single longsword attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: While not in Bulwark Stance, the Black Prior adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Black Prior must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Bowmaster has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Horde Breaker
entries: Once on each of its turns when it makes a greatbow attack, the Bowmaster can make another attack with its greatbow against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range.

trait.name: Tactical Retreat
entries: Opportunity attacks against the Bowmaster are made with disadvantage.

trait.name: Deadly Precision
entries: Once per turn, when the Bowmaster hits a creature with a greatbow attack, the creature takes an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage if it's below its hit point maximum.

trait.name: Point-Blank Shot
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on the Bowmaster's ranged attack rolls.

trait.name: Steady Aim
entries: The Bowmaster can use a bonus action to steady itself. While it is steadied, its attacks with the great bow deal {@damage 2d6} piercing damage. The Bowmaster is no longer steadied if it moves.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Bowmaster makes two greatbow attacks or two arming sword attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Greatbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 200/800 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, or 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage if used when braced.

action.name: Arming Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Volley {@recharge}
entries: The Bowmaster makes a single ranged attack against any number of creatures within 10 feet of a point it can see within its greatbow's range, making a separate attack roll for each target.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Bowmaster adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Bowmaster must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The Centurion has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Eagle's Fury
entries: If the Centurion moves at least 10 feet towards a creature and hits it with the next melee attack they make, they deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to the creature.

trait.name: Incredibilis!
entries: Once per turn, when the Centurion hits a creature with an unarmed strike they can force them to make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Infirmus!
entries: The Centurion deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature that is {@condition prone} or {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Lion's Bite
entries: Once per turn, the Centurion may make one of their gladius attacks with a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, they add +10 to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Lion's Roar
entries: If the Centurion successfully grapples a creature they can make an unarmed strike against that creature as a bonus action.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Centurion can use their bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Gladius
entries: When wielding this weapon the Centurion can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action when they take the attack or multiattack action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Centurion makes three melee attacks with their gladius or unarmed strikes. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Gladius
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. On a hit the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry Counter
entries: The Centurion adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Centurion must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Centurion may make one unarmed strike against the creature that made the attack.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Conqueror has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the Conqueror hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Full Guard
entries: The Conqueror can use their action to assume a defensive stance. The Conqueror gains +3 to their AC until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Conqueror regains 9 hit points at the start of their turn if they have less than half their maximum hit points and have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Shield Charge
entries: If the Conqueror moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a shield bash on the same turn, the creature must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Wind Up
entries: The Conqueror may use their bonus action to spin their flail, readying for a powerful attack. The next flail attack they make adds +5 to the damage rolled; they lose this bonus if they are {@condition incapacitated} or knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Conqueror makes two melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Pugno Mortis {@recharge}
entries: The Conqueror can light and throw a black powder bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: If not in Full Guard, the Conqueror adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Conqueror must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon or a shield.

reaction.name: Uppercut
entries: When a creature misses the Conqueror with a melee attack after the Conqueror has taken the Full Guard action, the Conqueror can make a flail attack against that creature if it is in range. This ends the bonus from the Full Guard action.

trait.name: Bamboozle
entries: The Gladiator may replace one of their attacks on their turn with a feint, making a Charisma (Deception) check contested by the target creature's Wisdom (Insight). If the Gladiator is successful, they have advantage on their next attack against that creature.

trait.name: Bee's Sting
entries: The Gladiator may make a single melee attack with their trident as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The Gladiator has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Cheap Shot
entries: The Gladiator's first melee attack on their turn against a {@condition incapacitated} creature automatically hits.

trait.name: Fuscina Ictus
entries: Once per turn, when the Gladiator hits a creature with a trident melee attack they can force the creature to succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Skewer
entries: Once per turn, when the Gladiator hits a creature with a trident melee attack they can skewer their opponent. The creature takes the attack's damage as normal and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. The Gladiator makes no more attacks on their turn. The creature takes an additional 11 ({@damage 2d10}) piercing damage at the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Standing Ovation
entries: If the Gladiator hits a creature with all four of their attacks on a turn, they may make one additional attack against the same creature. If the additional attack hits, it is considered a critical hit.

trait.name: Sucker Punch
entries: Once per turn, the Gladiator may make an attack with their buckler instead of their trident. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Gladiator makes four trident melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) damage if used with both hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Buckler
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Counter Jab
entries: The Gladiator adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Gladiator may make one buckler attack against the creature that made the attack.

reaction.name: Skewer Deflect
entries: If a melee attack misses the Gladiator after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Gladiator may make one trident attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

trait.name: Steel Will
entries: The Gryphon has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Gryphon's Shove
entries: The Gryphon may replace their first attack on their turn with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and pushed back 5 feet.

trait.name: Dauntless Chase
entries: If the Gryphon moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with the next Bardiche attack they make on the same turn, they can force that creature to succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is moved to within 5ft. of the Gryphon on the opposite side to where they were, is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and is knocked {@condition prone}. Large creatures have advantage on the saving throw; Small or smaller creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw.
If the creature succeeds the Strength saving throw the Gryphon stops adjacent to the creature.
This cannot be used on the same attack as the Forceful Swirl or Soul Cleaver traits.

trait.name: Forceful Swirl
entries: The Gryphon may make their first Bardiche attack on their turn target all creatures within reach rather than one target.
This cannot be used on the same attack as the Dauntless Chase or Soul Cleaver traits.

trait.name: Veteran's Kick
entries: The Gryphon may replace their third Bardiche attack on their turn with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and pushed back 5 feet.
If the unarmed strike hits, the Gryphon may make one Bardiche attack with advantage as a bonus action.

trait.name: Soul Cleaver
entries: The Gryphon may make a single melee attack with their Bardiche as part of taking the Dodge action.
This cannot be used on the same attack as the Dauntless Chase or Forceful Swirl traits.

trait.name: Winner's Advantage
entries: When the Gryphon hits with a melee attack on their turn, their next melee attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Gryphon makes three melee attacks with their Bardiche. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Bardiche
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stern Stare {@recharge 5}
entries: The Gryphon chooses one creature they can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Draconite Bolt {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. On a hit, each creature friendly to the Gryphon within 30 feet of the target regains 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hitpoints.

action.name: Draconite Cleanser (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Gryphon lights and throws a bomb of odd alchemical origin at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 3d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.
For the next minute, each creature friendly to the Gryphon that starts their turn within 10 feet of the chosen point regains 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hitpoints.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Gryphon adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Gryphon must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Highlander can double their speed until the end of their turn. Once they use this trait, they can't use it again until they move 0 feet on one of their turns.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Highlander can use their bonus action to regain 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Dunmaghlas!
entries: As a bonus action the Highlander may enter an offensive stance. They gain advantage on melee attack rolls and may not take the parry or crushing counterstrike actions.
The Highlander may end this stance as a bonus action or after any Claymore attack (no action required). The stance ends automatically when the Highlander takes damage.

trait.name: Tír na nÓg
entries: If the Highlander successfully hits with both Claymore attacks on a turn while not in an offensive stance, they may make an additional Claymore attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Balor's Might
entries: Claymore attacks made while the Highlander is in an offensive stance deal an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

trait.name: Caber Toss
entries: If the Highlander successfully grapples a creature while in their offensive stance, they may move the {@condition grappled} creature 5 feet to either side of themselves as part of the grapple, ending the {@condition grappled} condition, knocking the creature {@condition prone} and making them {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Formorian Kick
entries: While the Highlander is in an offensive stance they may substitute one of their Claymore attacks for an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 5 feet and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Highlander makes two attacks with their Claymore. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Claymore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Highlander places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Highlander throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Highlander's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Highlander, the Highlander may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Highlander succeeds they may make a single claymore attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Highlander adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Highlander must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Deliverance
entries: When the Hitokiri reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on their turn, the Hitokiri gains 13 ({@dice 2d12}) temporary hit points.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Hitokiri regains 9 hit points at the start of their turn if they have less than half their maximum hit points and have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Rei Sweep
entries: Once per turn, the Hitokiri may make an unarmed strike instead an attack with their masakari axe. On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Mugen-ryu
entries: When the Hitokiri hits with a masakari axe attack, they can make an additional attack against the same creature as part of that attack or multiattack action. The Hitokiri may make up to three additional attacks this way in one turn.
If the Hitokiri uses their Mangetsu Rift trait, Meikai trait or Senbonzakura action, they do not gain an extra attack from this trait.

trait.name: Mangetsu Rift
entries: Once per turn, the Hitokiri may make one of their masakari axe attacks with a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, they add +10 to the attack's damage. This cannot be used on the same attack as the Senbonzakura trait.

trait.name: Meikai
entries: When the Hitokiri hits with a masakari axe attack, they can make a masakari backswing attack as a bonus action.
If the Hitokiri uses their Senbonzakura action, they do not gain an extra attack from this trait.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Hitokiri makes two masakari axe attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Masakari Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Masakari Backswing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Senbonzakura {@recharge}
entries: The Hitokiri makes a masakari axe attack with disadvantage on the attack roll. If the attack hits, it is considered a critical hit and it deals an extra 22 ({@damage 3d12}) damage.
Additionally if the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, it dies instantly.

reaction.name: Righteous Deflection
entries: The Hitokiri goes to parry and adds 4 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Hitokiri must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
If the attack misses after the parry, they gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Against All Odds
entries: If the number of hostile creatures within 15 feet of the Jiang Jun is greater than the number of allied creatures (including the Jiang Jun himself) then the Jiang Jun and all allied creatures within 15 feet gain a bonus to their melee and ranged attack's damage equal to the Jiang Jun's Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Jiang Jun can use their bonus action to regain 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Tough Discipline
entries: The Jiang Jun has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mighty Sanction
entries: The Jiang Jun may make a single melee attack with their guandao as part of taking the Dodge action.

Additionally the Jiang Jun may instead make an unarmed strike as part of taking the Dodge action, kicking the target in the shin. On a hit, the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Twofold Slash
entries: Once per turn, when the Jiang Jun makes a melee attack they may make an additional attack with their guandao as part of the same action. On a hit, the additional attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 1d10}) damage.

trait.name: Fatal Swirl
entries: Once per turn when the Jiang Jun takes the attack action using their guandao, they may make their attack target all creatures within reach rather than one target.

trait.name: Sifu's Poise
entries: The Jiang Jun may use his bonus action to adopt graceful stance, any creature within 20 feet of the Jiang Jun that has to make a roll to recharge one of their abilities automatically succeeds on the roll on their turn.
The Jiang Jun may end this stance as a bonus action on their turn, or it automatically ends if the Jiang Jun moves or takes damage.

action.name: Guandao
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Jiang Jun throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Jiang Jun's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Inspire {@recharge}
entries: All allied creatures within 15 feet of the Jiang Jun gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the Jiang Jun's Charisma modifier until the end of the Jiang Jun's next turn.

reaction.name: Dou Shi's Choke
entries: The Jiang Jun adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Jiang Jun must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Jiang Jun chokes the creature for a moment before slapping them back 5 feet, rendering the creature {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Dou Shi's Swirl
entries: The Jiang Jun adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Jiang Jun must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Jiang Jun may make one guandao attack using his fatal swirl trait.

reaction.name: Sifu's Dodge
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Jiang Jun, the Jiang Jun may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Jiang Jun succeeds they dodge back into Sifu's Poise and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

trait.name: Punch Through
entries: Whenever the Jormungandr has disadvantage on a melee attack roll they make with their warhammer, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to the Jormungandr's Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two {@dice d20} rolls would have hit.

trait.name: Jotunn Gift
entries: If the Jormungandr successfully grapples a creature, the Jormungandr has advantage on their next melee attack roll against the {@condition grappled} creature so long as the creature remains {@condition grappled}.
On a hit the creature is pushed back 5 feet, ending the grapple, and the Jormungandr gains hit points equal to the damage dealt by the attack.

trait.name: Jotunn Farewell
entries: If the Jormungandr successfully hits a creature with a warhammer attack on their turn, they may immediately make an unarmed strike against that creature with advantage as a bonus action.
On a hit the creature is pushed back 5 feet, and the Jormungandr gains hit points equal to the damage dealt by the attack.

trait.name: Serpent Smite
entries: If the Jormungandr moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and makes a melee attack against it, the Jormungandr gains advantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Hamarr Slam
entries: The Jormungandr deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) damage to a creature that is {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Hamarr's Favour
entries: If the Jormungandr hits a creature that is {@condition prone} with an attack from their warhammer, they gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Jormungandr makes two melee attacks with their warhammer. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Light Hammer
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Twilight of the Gods {@recharge}
entries: The Jormungandr smashes their hammer into the ground. Each creature within 10 feet of the Jormungandr must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage, be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Jotunn Grudge
entries: The Jormungandr adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Jormungandr must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Jormungandr may make one unarmed strike against the creature that made the attack.
On a hit the creature is pushed back 5 feet, and the Jormungandr gains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The Kensei has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Kensei can use their bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Swift Strike
entries: The Kensei may make a single melee attack with their nodachi as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Dawn of the Steel Sun
entries: If the Kensei hits with a nodachi attack on their turn, they may make one additional attack with advantage using their nodachi as a bonus action. On a hit, it deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

trait.name: Helm Splitter
entries: Once per turn, the Kensei may make an attack with their pommel strike instead of their nodachi. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kensei makes two nodachi attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Nodachi
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pommel Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Inspire {@recharge}
entries: All allied creatures within 15 feet of the Kensei gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the Kensei's Charisma modifier until the end of the Kensei's next turn.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Kensei throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Kensei adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Kensei must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave Devotion
entries: The Kyoshin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Aoarashi
entries: The Kyoshin may replace their second shikomizue blade attack on their turn for a shikomizue scabbard attack. On a hit, in addition to the damage, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.
If the shikomizue scabbard attack hits, the Kyoshin may make one shikomizue blade attack with advantage as a bonus action.

trait.name: Sajin-Arashi
entries: The Kyoshin may make a single melee attack with their shikomizue blade as part of taking the Dodge action.

Additionally the Kyoshin may instead make an unarmed strike as part of taking the Dodge action, kicking the target. On a hit, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Kaze Stance
entries: The Kyoshin can use their action to assume this defensive stance; if they have taken the attack or multiattack action on their turn, they may do this as a bonus action. Whilst in this stance the Kyoshin's movement is reduced to 5 feet, they gain +3 to their AC and may only take the Fujin Cuts action or the Tengukaze reaction.

The Kyoshin can exit this stance as a bonus action on their turn; they automatically exit this stance after they take the Fujin Cuts action, use the Tengukaze reaction or if they are {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Hikari to Kage
entries: When the Kyoshin hits with an attack using their shikomizue blade while in Kaze Stance or as part of the Crushing Counterstrike reaction, the creature takes an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage at the start of their next turn and the Kyoshin regains hit points equal to that additional damage.
Multiple instances of this effect stack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kyoshin makes two shikomizue blade attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Shikomizue Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shikomizue Scabbard
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fujin Cuts (Only in Kaze Stance)
entries: The Kyoshin makes a shikomizue blade attack against a creature within range. If the attack hits, they can make an additional shikomizue blade attack against the same creature as part of this action. The Kyoshin may make up to four attacks this way in one turn.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: While not in Kaze Stance, as a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Kyoshin, the Kyoshin may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Kyoshin succeeds they may make a single shikomizue blade attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Tengukaze
entries: While in Kaze Stance, as a reaction to a creature missing a melee attack against the Kyoshin, the Kyoshin may take the Fujin Cuts action against the creature as part of this reaction. The first attack of the Fujin Cuts action is made with advantage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: While not in Kaze Stance, the Kyoshin adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Kyoshin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Impaling Charge
entries: If the Lawbringer moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with the next melee weapon attack they make on the same turn, the target takes the attack damage as normal and is pushed back a number of feet equal to the remainder of the Lawbringer's movement speed, the Lawbringer continuing in a straight line with the target.

trait.name: Steel Will
entries: The lawbringer has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Powerful Shove
entries: The Lawbringer may replace one of their Halberd attacks on a turn with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and pushed back 5 feet.

trait.name: Ruat Caelum
entries: Whilst wielding a halberd, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack when entering the Lawbringer's reach.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Lawbringer can use their bonus action to regain 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Swift Justice
entries: If the Lawbringer hits a creature at least twice with a Halberd on their turn, they can make a Halberd Cue attack against that creature as a bonus action.

trait.name: The Long Arm
entries: Once per turn the Lawbringer may substitute one of their melee attacks with an attempt to flip a target over them. If the creature is Large or smaller they must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be moved to within 5ft. of the Lawbringer on the opposite side to where they were, be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}. Large creatures have advantage on the saving throw; Small or smaller creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Lawbringer makes three melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage.

action.name: Halberd Cue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning or piercing damage. On a hit the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Igneus Imber {@recharge}
entries: The Lawbringer can light and throw black powder bombs at up to three points up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of a chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Parry Punish
entries: The Lawbringer adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Lawbringer must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Lawbringer may make one Halberd or Halberd Cue attack against the creature that made the attack.

trait.name: Throne Guard
entries: The Medjay may make a single melee attack with its fan axe as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Stance Switch
entries: As a bonus action the Medjay may change the mode of their fan axe from a staff to a pair of one-handed axes or vice versa. The Medjay uses a different profile depending on the mode of their fan axe; additionally as a pair of axes the Medjay can make an additional attack as a bonus action when they take the attack or multiattack actions.

trait.name: Sunlight Strength
entries: When the When the Medjay reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it gains a bonus depending on its stance:

items: {@b {@i Staff.}} The Medjay reduces any bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that they take from nonmagical attacks by 3.
{@b {@i Paired.}} The Medjay's melee weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d4} damage.

entries: The Medjay may have both bonuses at the same time; these bonuses last until the Medjay finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Stoic Devotion
entries: The Medjay has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Moonlight Drain
entries: When the Medjay successfully grapples a creature while in Staff stance, they can immediately release the creature and reduce the creature's AC by 3 until the end of its next turn.
Additionally if when the Medjay successfully shoves a creature while in Paired Stance, the creature reduces all weapon damage rolls they make by 3 until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Scarab Relief
entries: The Medjay can use their bonus action to cause themselves and nearby allies within 15 feet to regain 6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) hit points if the Medjay is in Staff stance.
Alternatively when the Medjay is in Paired stance, they can use their bonus action to regain 12 ({@dice 2d8 + 3}) hit points.
They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Medjay makes two melee attacks with their fan axe. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Fan Axe (Staff)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fan Axe (Paired)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Astral Manifestation {@recharge}
entries: The Medjay does one of the following, depending on their current stance:

items: {@b {@i Staff.}} The Medjay lights and throws a black powder bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

{@b {@i Paired.}} The Medjay's throws spectral fan axes at one creature within 30 feet. Make an ranged attack roll with the Medjay's fan axe; on a hit the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) force damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Medjay adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Medjay must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Nobushi can use their bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Way of the Shark
entries: When the Nobushi hits with an attack using their naginata, the creature takes an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage at the start of their next turn. Multiple instances of this effect stack.

trait.name: Cobra Strike
entries: The Nobushi may make a single melee attack with their naginata as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Poke the Nest
entries: If the Nobushi hits with two melee attacks on their turn, they may make one additional attack using their naginata that automatically hits as a bonus action.

trait.name: Jump Kick
entries: If the Nobushi hits with a naginata attack, they can replace the next attack they make on their turn with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn, be pushed 5 feet back and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Viper's Retreat
entries: The Nobushi may make a single naginata attack with their naginata as part of taking the Disengage action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nobushi makes two naginata attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Naginata
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Trap {@recharge}
entries: The Nobushi sets down a fire trap, a small portion of black powder surrounded by a flammable liquid with a pressure plate on top of the casing. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Nobushi's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Nobushi throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Hidden Stance
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Nobushi, the Nobushi may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Nobushi succeeds they dodge back into a deceptive stance and the triggering attack is wasted; the Nobushi gains advantage on their next melee attack. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Nobushi adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Nobushi must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Deadly Duet
entries: The Nuxia deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage to a creature they hit with a weapon attack if that creature and the Nuxia are not within 5 feet of another creature, besides themselves, that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Nuxia regains 8 hit points at the start of their turn if they have less than half their maximum hit points and have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Hook Trap
entries: Once per turn, the Nuxia may make one of their hooked sword attacks a trap. If the attack misses they grapple the target and may immediately make a hilt spike attack with advantage against it.
However if the trapped attack hits, it deals no damage.

trait.name: Song of the Moon
entries: If the Nuxia successfully hits with all of their melee attacks on a turn, they may use a bonus action to move the last creature hit by their attacks 10 feet in a direction of the Nuxia's choosing that's no more than 10 feet away from the Nuxia.

trait.name: Crescent Step
entries: The Nuxia may make a single hilt spike attack as part of taking the Dodge action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nuxia makes three melee attacks with their hooked swords. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Hooked Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hilt Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Caltrops {@recharge}
entries: The Nuxia spreads caltrops to cover a 10-foot-square area within 30 feet of them. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or stop moving and take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage. Until the creature regains at least 1 hit point, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the saving throw.
The Nuxia is immune to the effect of the caltrops.

action.name: Infection {@recharge}
entries: The Nuxia chooses a creature within 30 feet to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, for 1 minute, the creature and any allies of that creature within 15 feet of them at the start of each of their turns take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Thread of Fate {@recharge}
entries: The Nuxia chooses a creature within 30 feet to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature's movement speed is halved for 1 minute.

reaction.name: Echo Strike
entries: If a melee attack misses the Nuxia after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Nuxia may make one hilt spike attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

reaction.name: Mirror Raid
entries: The Nuxia adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them. To do so, the Nuxia must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Nuxia may make one hilt spike attack against the creature that made the attack.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Ocelotl adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Ocelotl must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Ocelotl makes two attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Macuahuitl
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tepoztopilli (Spear)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing or slashing damage in melee, or 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage at range.

action.name: Double Edge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Ocelotl places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Death Whistle {@recharge}
entries: Each hostile creature that is within 30 feet of the Ocelotl and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Ocelotl's Death Whistle for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Trapper's Reach {@recharge}
entries: The Ocelotl attaches rope to their tepoztopilli and throws it at one creature they can see within 30 feet, making a ranged attack roll. On a hit the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, is pulled up to 30 feet towards the Ocelotl, is {@condition grappled}, and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn, where it takes an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage. On a miss, the Ocelotl pulls their tepoztopilli back to them by the rope.

trait.name: Jaguar's Claw
entries: The Ocelotl may make a single melee attack with their tepoztopilli as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Jaguar's Grudge
entries: The Ocelotl may replace one or both of their attacks on their turn with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and pushed back 5 feet.
If the Ocelotl replaces both attacks with unarmed strikes and the second attack hits, it deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Tonatiuh's Warpath
entries: If the Ocelotl hits with a macuahuitl or tepoztopilli attack on their turn, they may make one additional attack with advantage using the same weapon as a bonus action.

trait.name: Hunter's Snare
entries: If the Ocelotl moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then makes a macuahuitl attack against it on the same turn, the creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Quetzalcoatl's Blessing
entries: When the Ocelotl reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the Ocelotl's speed increases by 15 feet and they deal an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage when they hit with macuahuitl, tepoztopilli and double edge attacks until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Huntsman's Spirit
entries: The Ocelotl can attempt to hide even when it is only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

Additionally the Ocelotl can spend 1 minute while obscured this way to become {@condition invisible}. While {@condition invisible} this way their movement speed is increased by 15 feet. This invisibility lasts for 1 hour and ends early if they take the attack or multiattack action or if no longer obscured by natural phenomena.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the officer can deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the officer that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Officer Tactics
entries: Allied creatures have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of the officer that is hostile to it.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Storm Rush
entries: If the Orochi moves 0 feet on its turn, they can take the ready action to perform a storm rush. This action is triggered when a hostile creature comes within 20 feet of the Orochi; the Orochi then moves up to half their movement speed towards the creature and makes a two handed Katana attack against it with advantage. On a hit, it deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage.

trait.name: Lightning Strikes Twice
entries: If the Orochi hits with a katana attack on their turn, they may make one additional attack with advantage using their katana as a bonus action. On a hit, it deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

trait.name: Zephyr Slash
entries: The Orochi may make a single melee attack with their katana as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The Orochi can take the {@action Disengage} or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of their turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Orochi makes two katana attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit or {@hit 5} to hit with both hands, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Kunai
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. The Orochi can throw up to 2 kunai as part of an attack when they take the attack action; for each thrown above the first they add an additional damage die.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Nail Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Orochi sets down a nail bomb, a small portion of black powder surrounded by many metal spikes with a pressure plate on top. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage.
Creatures that fail the Dexterity save take an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of their next turn. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Orochi throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Hurricane Blast
entries: If a melee attack misses the Orochi after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Orochi may make one katana attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Orochi adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Orochi must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Cold Blooded Killer
entries: The Peacekeeper has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Deep Gouge
entries: If the Peacekeeper successfully hits a creature with a melee attack from its arming sword they can make an attack with advantage using their dagger as a bonus action on the same turn.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The Peacekeeper can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of their turns.

trait.name: Sidestep Strike
entries: The Peacekeeper may make a single melee attack with their arming sword as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Stealthy
entries: The Peacekeeper has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Peacekeeper makes two melee attacks with their arming sword. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Arming Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. On a hit the creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the start of its next turn or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage. The creature repeats this save each turn for 1 minute or until it succeeds. Multiple instances of this effect stack.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Deflect
entries: If a melee attack misses the Peacekeeper after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Peacekeeper may make one dagger attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Peacekeeper adds 4 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Peacekeeper must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the pikeman can deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the pikeman that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Tower Shield
entries: Whilst wielding this shield, if the pikeman is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it can use its reaction to take no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, interposing the shield between itself and the source of the effect. Additionally it counts as being in half cover against ranged attacks whilst wielding this shield.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Close Quarter Fighter
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on ranged attack rolls the Pirate makes with their pistol.

trait.name: Sea Wolf's Glide
entries: The Pirate may make a single melee attack with their cutlass as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Pistol Blast
entries: Once per turn, when the Pirate hits with an attack using their cutlass they may immediately use their bonus action to make an attack with their pistol or trick shot. On a hit, in addition to the damage, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.
If the pistol or trick shot attack is against the same creature the Pirate hit with their cutlass attack, it has advantage.

trait.name: Walk the Plank!
entries: Once per turn, the Pirate may make one of their cutlass attacks with a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, they add +10 to the attack's damage and may immediately use their bonus action to push the creature 5 feet away from themselves.
This cannot be used on the same attack as the Sea Wolf's Glide trait.

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The Pirate has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Pirate makes two cutlass attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Cutlass
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Trick Shot {@recharge}
entries: The Pirate makes a pistol attack. On a hit, the shot ricochets and the Pirate may repeat the attack against another creature within 10 feet of the the previous target; it may repeat this way a number of times up to the pirate's Dexterity modifier.

action.name: Pocket Bomb {@recharge 5}
entries: The Pirate can light and throw a black powder bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Gundpowder Surprise {@recharge}
entries: The Pirate fires a hand cannon at a point up to 30 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, be pushed 10 feet away from the point and knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Pirate adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Pirate must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Raider's Storm
entries: Once per turn, the Raider may substitute one of their long axe attacks for a Raider's Fury.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Raider can use their bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Raider can double their speed until the end of their turn. Once they use this trait, they can't use it again until they move 0 feet on one of their turns.

trait.name: Storming Tap
entries: Once per turn, the Raider may make an attack with their long axe's pommel instead of their long axe. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Stampede Charge
entries: When the Raider successfully grapples a creature, they may carry the creature and move up to half their movement speed forward before throwing the {@condition grappled} creature 5 feet in front of where the Raider stops, ending the grapple and knocking the other creature {@condition prone}.
Additionally if the Raider moved at least 10 feet towards a creature and attempts to grapple it, the Raider has advantage on their Athletics roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Raider makes three melee attacks with their long axe. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Long Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pommel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Raider's Fury
entries: The Raider makes a long axe attack against three creatures within reach that are within 5 feet of each other; one attack and damage roll is used against all three targets.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Raider places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Raider throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Raider's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Raider adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Raider must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon or a shield.

trait.name: Crazed Devotion
entries: The shaman has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Shaman can double their speed until the end of their turn. Once they use this trait, they can't use it again until they move 0 feet on one of their turns.

trait.name: Raven's Claw
entries: If the Shaman successfully hits a creature with a melee attack from their handaxe they can make an attack with advantage using their kukri knife as a bonus action on the same turn.

On a hit the target creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage at the start of its next turn. The creature repeats this save each turn for 1 minute or until it succeeds. Multiple instances of this effect stack.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Shaman can use their bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

trait.name: Wild Cat's Swiftness
entries: The Shaman may make a single melee attack with their handaxe as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Blood Trance
entries: If the Shaman hits a creature affected by their Raven's Claw trait or Raven's Beak reaction with a melee attack, the Shaman regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

Additionally if the Shaman successfully grapples an affected creature the Shaman bites them, dealing 12 ({@damage 5d4}) necrotic damage, healing the Shaman a number of hit points equal to the damage caused and ending the grapple.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shaman makes two melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Kukri Knife
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Shaman places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Shaman throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Shaman's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Nail Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Shaman sets down a nail bomb, a small portion of black powder surrounded by many metal spikes with a pressure plate on top. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage.
Creatures that fail the Dexterity save take an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of their next turn. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Shaman adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Shaman must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Raven's Beak
entries: If a melee attack misses the Shaman after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Shaman may make one Kukri Knife attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed. On a hit the target creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the start of its next turn or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage. The creature repeats this save each turn for 1 minute or until it succeeds. Multiple instances of this effect stack.

trait.name: Winner's Advantage
entries: When the Shaolin hits with a melee attack on their turn, their next melee attack deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage.

trait.name: Shadowstep
entries: The Shaolin may make a single melee attack with their steel-capped staff as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Flying Monkey
