entries: If the Shaolin moves at least 10 feet towards a creature and takes the multiattack action on their turn, the Shaolin may replace the first attack with their steel-capped staff with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Qi Stance
entries: If the Shaolin makes a melee attack on their turn, they may use their bonus action to enter a Qi stance. While in this stance, the Shaolin's movement speed is reduced to 5 feet. The Shaolin may end this stance on their turn (no action required); this stance requires {@status concentration}, as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell.

trait.name: Lotus Leap
entries: If the Shaolin makes a two handed attack with their steel-capped staff while in Qi Stance, the attack has advantage and deals 9 ({@damage 2d8}) additional damage on a hit.

trait.name: Sun Kick
entries: If the Shaolin is in Qi Stance, they may replace one of their steel-capped staff attacks with an unarmed strike with advantage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shaolin makes three melee attacks with their steel-capped staff. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove. They may also replace one of these attacks with Blink if they are able.

action.name: Steel-capped Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Blink {@recharge}
entries: The Shaolin teleports to an unoccupied space 5 feet behind a creature that is within 10 feet of the Shaolin and makes an unarmed strike against that creature with advantage. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Blessed Projection {@recharge}
entries: The Shaolin chooses an allied creature within 120 feet of themselves, they then teleport to an unoccupied space that is within 5 feet of the chosen ally.

reaction.name: Bounding Blossom
entries: If the Shaolin is in Qi Stance they may, as a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against them, force the creature to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Shaolin succeeds they may make a single steel-capped staff attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Shaolin adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the Shaolin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Shadow Deflect
entries: If a melee attack misses the Shaolin after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Shaolin may make one attack using their steel-capped staff with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the officer can deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the officer that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Officer Tactics
entries: Allied creatures have advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature within 5 feet of the officer that is hostile to it.

action.name: Broadsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Yama Uba
entries: When the Shinobi hits a creature with a kusarigama attack they regain 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points.

trait.name: Kusarigama-Jutsu
entries: The sickle-like weapons the Shinobi uses are on chains with a weight at the end. When the Shinobi makes a ranged attack by throwing one of their kusarigama they pull the weapon back to their hand by the chain as part of the attack.

Additionally the Shinobi may attempt to grapple a Medium or smaller creature after hitting with a ranged kusarigama attack instead of dealing damage. If the grapple is successful, the Shinobi can pull the creature up to 15 feet towards them.

trait.name: Slide Tackle
entries: The Shinobi may take the Dash action as a bonus action. Additionally if they take the Dash action and move at least 10 feet towards a creature they can attempt to perform a slide tackle.

The creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn. The Shinobi moves to the opposite side of the tackled creature. On a successful save the creature is not {@condition incapacitated} or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sickle Rain
entries: If the Shinobi hits with two kusarigama attacks on a turn, they can use their bonus action to make three melee attacks with their kusarigama. Each of these attacks deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage on a hit.

trait.name: Nimble Attacker
entries: The Shinobi can take the Disengage or Dodge action as a bonus action on each of their turns.
Additionally the Shinobi may make one kusarigama or kick attack as part of these actions.

trait.name: Flying Kick
entries: Once per turn, the Shinobi can replace a kusarigama attack with a kick attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shinobi makes two melee or ranged attacks with their kusarigama. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Kusarigama
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10/20 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit the creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Shuriken
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage. The Shinobi can throw up to 3 shuriken as part of the same attack; for each thrown above the first they add an additional damage die.

action.name: Nail Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Shinobi sets down a nail bomb, a small portion of black powder surrounded by many metal spikes with a pressure plate on top. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage.
Creatures that fail the Dexterity save take an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of their next turn. On a successful save the damage is halved.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Shinobi throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Shadow Strike
entries: The Shinobi adds 4 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Shinobi must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Shinobi may make one kusarigama attack against the creature that made the attack.
If the Shinobi's attack hits the creature takes an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage at the start of their next turn.

reaction.name: Teleport Deflect
entries: If a melee attack misses the Shinobi after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Shinobi may teleport to within 5ft. of the creature on the opposite side to where they were and make one melee attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Shugoki regains 9 hit points at the start of their turn if they have less than half their maximum hit points and have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Punch Through
entries: Whenever the Shugoki has disadvantage on a melee attack roll they make with their kanabo, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to its Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two {@dice d20} rolls would have hit.

trait.name: Rock Steady
entries: The Shugoki cannot be knocked {@condition prone} by non-magical means. They also have advantage on saving throws against spells or other effects that would force them to move.

trait.name: Hard to Kill
entries: If the Shugoki has less than half of their maximum hit points, they have resistance to all damage except psychic damage.

trait.name: Bonecrusher
entries: Once per turn, the Shugoki may make one of with their kanabo attacks with a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, they add +10 to the attack's damage.

trait.name: Headbutt
entries: If the Shugoki hits with the first kanabo attack on their turn, they may make an unarmed strike instead of their second kanabo attack. On a hit, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Demon's Embrace
entries: If the Shugoki successfully grapples a creature, they may use their bonus action to crush the creature in an embrace. The creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone} and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. The Shugoki regains hit points equal to the damage dealt and ends the grapple when using this trait.

trait.name: Charge of the Oni
entries: When the Shugoki takes the Dash action they may move freely through another creatures space as long as they are Large or smaller. The creature is moved 5 feet away from the Shugoki and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Shugoki has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shugoki makes two melee attacks with their kanabo. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Kanabo
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Smoke Bomb {@recharge}
entries: The Shugoki throws a smoke bomb at the floor, it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Shugoki adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Shugoki must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Sohei has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Sohei regains 9 hit points at the start of their turn if they have less than half their maximum hit points and have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Ancillary Might
entries: While the Sohei has 6 soul charges, they deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage on each of their weapon attacks.

trait.name: Yamabushi Spirit
entries: The Sohei may make a single melee attack with their kama-yari as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Soul Weapon Strikes
entries: When the Sohei hits with a kama-yari attack, they may make one Kodachi, Saw, Club, Wood Hammer, Kama, or Sasumata attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: God Hand
entries: The Sohei may replace their first kama-yari attack on their turn with an unarmed strike. On a hit, the creature takes 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and pushed back 5 feet.

Additionally if the Sohei has 6 soul charges when the unarmed strike hits, they may replace their second kama-yari attack with Seven-Force Strike instead; if they use it against the same creature, the attack they make automatically hits.

trait.name: Soul Collector
entries: When the Sohei hits with an attack using their Kodachi, Saw, Club, Wood Hammer, Kama, or Sasumata that weapon gains a soul charge. Only one soul charge can be held in each weapon at a time.
These charges remain until the Sohei dies or they are expended.

trait.name: Mountain Sunderer
entries: If the Sohei successfully grapples a creature, they may use their bonus action to make three melee attacks with their Kodachi, Saw, Club, Wood Hammer, Kama, or Sasumata. Each weapon can only be used to make one attack.

reaction.name: Parry Punish
entries: The Sohei adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Sohei must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses after the parry, the Sohei may make one Kodachi, Saw, Club, Wood Hammer, Kama, or Sasumata attack against the creature that made the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sohei makes two kama-yari attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Kama-yari (Spear)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Kodachi
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Saw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage. On a hit the target takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage at the start of their next turn.

action.name: Iron Club (Mace)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Wood Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Kama
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sasumata
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. On a hit, the target must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Eye of the Demon
entries: The Sohei chooses one creature it can see within 30 feet that must make a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save for 1 minute, whenever the target takes damage, it takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage of the same type.

action.name: Seven-Force Strike
entries: The Sohei grabs a creature and runs them through with their kama-yari, empowered by the collected souls.
The Sohei expends 6 soul charges and makes a one-handed attack with their kama-yari against one creature within their reach. On a hit it deals an additional 45 ({@damage 7d12}) force damage.

action.name: Soul Soother
entries: The Sohei expends 6 soul charges and regains 52 ({@dice 8d12}) hit points.

action.name: Soul Waker (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The Sohei gains one soul charge in each of their soul weapons that isn't already holding a charge.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the soldier can deal an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the soldier that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Broadsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Vital Leech
entries: If the Tiandi has less than half of their maximum hit points, they regain hit points equal to the damage dealt when they hit with their dao attacks.

trait.name: Indomitable
entries: When the Tiandi drops below 20 hit points they gain 18 ({@dice 4d8}) temporary hit points. If the triggering damage would reduce the Tiandi to 0 hit points, they instead remain on 1 hit point.
After this is triggered the Tiandi regains the use of this trait after they finish a short or long rest.

trait.name: Dragon Dodge
entries: The Tiandi may make a single melee attack with their dao as part of taking the Dodge action.
Additionally the Tiandi may take the Dodge action as a bonus action on each of their turns.

trait.name: Dragon Kick
entries: If the Tiandi successfully hits a creature with a melee attack from their dao they can make an unarmed strike with advantage as a bonus action on the same turn.
On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 15 feet, knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Palm Strike
entries: Once per turn, the Tiandi may make an unarmed strike instead of an attack with their dao. On a hit, the creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be pushed back 5 feet and {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tiandi makes two melee attacks with their dao. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Dao
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Battlecry {@recharge}
entries: All allied creatures within 15 feet of the Tiandi gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the Tiandi's Charisma modifier until the end of the Tiandi's next turn. All hostile creatures within 15 feet must succeed a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the Tiandi until the end of their next turn.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Tiandi adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Tiandi must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Tiger Dodge
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Tiandi after they have taken the dodge action on their turn, the Tiandi may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Tiandi succeeds they may make a single dao attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Valkyrie can double their speed until the end of their turn. Once they use this trait, they can't use it again until they move 0 feet on one of their turns.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Valkyrie regains 8 hit points at the start of their turn if they have less than half their maximum hit points and have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Hunter's Strike
entries: The Valkyrie may make a single melee attack with their spear as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Spear Sweep
entries: If the Valkyrie hits with their first two melee attacks on a turn, they may substitute their third attack for a sweep with their spear against a creature within 5 feet. The creature must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw at disadvantage. On a failed save the creature is knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.
If the creature fails the save the Valkyrie can make a spear attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Pouncing Thrust
entries: If the Valkyrie moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a spear attack on the same turn, the attack deals an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage.

trait.name: Boar Hunter
entries: Once per turn, the Valkyrie may increase the reach for one of their spear attacks by 5 feet.

trait.name: Full Block
entries: The Valkyrie can use their action to assume a defensive stance. The Valkyrie gains +3 to their AC until the start of their next turn or until they take damage. However, the Valkyrie's movement speed is reduced to 0 feet and they can only take the Crushing Counterstrike and Shield Tackle reactions.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Valkyrie makes three melee attacks with their spear. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the creature must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw; on a failed save the creature is knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Valkyrie places down a {@item hunting trap|PHB}.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Valkyrie throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Valkyrie's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Valkyrie, the Valkyrie may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check.

If the Valkyrie succeeds they may make a single spear attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. If the Valkyrie had taken the Full Block action on their previous turn they make a shield bash attack instead of a spear attack and the bonus from Full Block ends.
Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Valkyrie adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Valkyrie must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon or a shield.

reaction.name: Shield Tackle
entries: When a creature misses the Valkyrie with a melee attack after the Valkyrie has taken the Full Block action, the Valkyrie can make a Shield Bash attack against that creature if it is in range. This ends the bonus from the Full Block action.

reaction.name: Shoulder Pin
entries: If a melee attack misses the Valkyrie after they take the Dodge action on their turn, the Valkyrie may make one spear attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack which missed. If that spear attack hits, the creature takes an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage at the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Varangian Guard makes two melee attacks with their battleaxe. They may replace one or more of these attack with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Bearded Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Oathkeeper
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Varangian Guard, the Varangian Guard may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Varangian Guard succeeds they may do one of the following options against the creature and the creature's triggering attack is wasted:

items: {@b {@i Hjaldr:}} The Varangian Guard makes a bearded axe attack; on a hit all allied creatures within 15 feet gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.
{@b {@i Aesir:}} The Varangian Guard makes a bearded axe attack with advantage.
{@b {@i Smite:}} The Varangian Guard makes a shield bash attack. On a hit the target is pushed back 10 feet and {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

entries: Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Varangian Guard adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Varangian Guard must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Aesir Fury
entries: If the Varangian Guard successfully hits a creature with an attack on their turn, they gain advantage on their next attack against that creature until the end of their turn.

trait.name: Misthia Ward
entries: The first time the Varangian Guard successfully hits another creature with a melee attack on a turn, they gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Aesir Aura
entries: If the Varangian Guard hits a creature with both its melee attacks on its turn, the Varangian Guard and all allied creatures within 15 feet gain a bonus to their weapon damage rolls equal to the Varangian Guard's Charisma modifier until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Aesir Bind
entries: When the Varangian Guard hits a creature with its battleaxe on its turn, the creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the the end of the Varangian Guard's turn.

trait.name: Sellsword's Smite
entries: If the Varangian Guard hits a creature with both its melee attacks on its turn, they can make an unarmed strike against it as a bonus action. On a hit, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and pushed back 5 feet.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Varangian Guard regains 9 hit points at the start of their turn if they have less than half their maximum hit points and have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The warden has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Half-Swording
entries: The Warden is able to grapple creatures whilst holding their longsword as if they had a hand free. Additionally when they make a Grapple or a Shove they have advantage on the related Strength rolls.

trait.name: Shoulder Bash
entries: If the Warden hits a creature at least twice with a melee weapon on its turn, they can make a shove attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Second Wind
entries: The Warden can use their bonus action to regain 7 ({@dice 1d8 + 3}) hit points. They regain the use of this ability after finishing a short or long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Warden makes three melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning, piercing or slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Inspire {@recharge}
entries: All allied creatures within 15 feet of the Warden gain a bonus to their attack and damage rolls equal to the Warden's Charisma modifier until the end of the Warden's next turn.

action.name: Pugno Mortis {@recharge}
entries: The Warden can light and throw a black powder bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Crushing Counterstrike
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Warden, the Warden may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Warden succeeds they may make a single melee attack against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Warden adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Warden must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Rush
entries: The Warlord can double their speed until the end of their turn. Once they use this trait, they can't use it again until they move 0 feet on one of their turns.

trait.name: Headsplitter Leap
entries: If the Warlord moves at least 5 feet straight towards a creature and hits it with their first melee attack on a turn, they may substitute their second melee attack with an attempt to headbutt a creature.

If the creature is Large or smaller they must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. The Warlord may then make an attack with their sword as a bonus action.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Warlord regains 9 hit points at the start of their turn if they have less than half their maximum hit points and have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Full Guard
entries: The Warlord can use their action to assume a defensive stance. The Warlord gains +3 to their AC until the start of their next turn. Whilst in Full Guard the Warlord may make one melee attack as a bonus action

trait.name: Crashing Charge
entries: If the Warlord moves at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a shield bash on the same turn, they can force that creature to succeed a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice). On a failed save the creature is pushed back as far as the Warlord continues to move, up to the Warlord's remaining movement speed.

If the creature succeeds the Strength saving throw the Warlord stops adjacent to the creature. If the creature succeeds the Dexterity saving throw the Warlord continues moving past the creature for 10 feet before stopping.

trait.name: Punch Through
entries: Whenever the Warlord has disadvantage on a melee attack roll they make with their Ulfberht Sword, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to the Warlord's Strength modifier (minimum of 0) if the attack misses but the higher of the two {@dice d20} rolls would have hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Warlord makes two melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attack with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Ulfberht Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bear Trap {@recharge 5}
entries: The Warlord places down a hunting trap.

action.name: Fire Flask {@recharge}
entries: The Warlord throws a flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 5d4}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the Warlord's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity save or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

reaction.name: Headbutt Riposte
entries: When a creature misses the Warlord with a melee attack after the Warlord has taken the Full Guard action, the Warlord can attempt to headbutt a creature.

If the creature is Large or smaller they must succeed a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. The Warlord may then make an attack with their sword as part of this reaction. This ends the bonus from the Full Guard action.

reaction.name: Shield Counter
entries: If not in Full Guard the Warlord adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Warlord must see the attacker and be wielding a shield. If the attack misses after the Shield Counter, the Warlord may make one melee attack with their sword against the creature that made the attack as part of this reaction.

trait.name: Beast of Prey
entries: The Warmonger may make either a single two-handed melee attack with advantage using their flamberge bastard sword or a single clawed gauntlet attack as part of taking the Dodge action.

trait.name: Corrupted Blade
entries: The Warmonger uses their bonus action to coat their flamberge bastard sword with corrupting energies. The next time the Warmonger hits a creature with a flamberge bastard sword attack that creature must succeed a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with corruption.

On a failed save, for 1 minute, the creature and any allies of that creature within 15 feet of them at the start of each of their turns take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. At the end of each of its turns the creature repeats the saving throw, ending the corruption early on a success.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The Warmonger has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Elixir of Corruption
entries: When the Warmonger hits a creature afflicted by corruption with a melee attack they regain 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points.

trait.name: Power of Corruption
entries: When the Warmonger hits a creature afflicted by corruption with a melee attack they deal an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Preying Claw
entries: Once per turn, when the Warmonger hits a creature with a clawed gauntlet attack they can force them to make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn and the Warmonger may use their bonus action to make a flamberge bastard sword attack against the same creature that automatically hits.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Warmonger makes three melee attacks. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Flamberge Bastard Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage, or 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Clawed Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage. On a hit, the creature takes an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage at the start of their next turn. Multiple instances of this effect stack.

action.name: Corruption Blast {@recharge}
entries: Each hostile creature within 15 feet of the Warmonger must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, for 1 minute, the creature and any allies of that creature within 15 feet of them at the start of each of their turns take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. At the end of each of its turns, the creature repeats the saving throw ending the corruption early on a success.

reaction.name: Impaling Riposte
entries: The Warmonger adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Warmonger must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

If the attack then misses, the Warmonger may make one flamberge bastard sword attack with advantage against the creature that made the attack. On a hit the target takes the attack damage as normal and is pushed back 10 feet with the Warmonger following the target.
If there isn't space for the target to be pushed back they are instead knocked {@condition prone} and take an additional 6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage from the Warmonger clawing at them.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Zhanhu's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Zhanhu regains 8 hit points at the start of their turn if they have less than half their maximum hit points and have at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Winner's Advantage
entries: When the Zhanhu hits with a melee attack on their turn, their next melee attack deals an additional 5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

trait.name: Absolute Amplitude
entries: Once per turn when the Zhanhu makes an attack using their changdao, they may make that attack target all creatures within reach rather than one target.

trait.name: Violent Maneuver
entries: The Zhanhu may make a single melee attack with their changdao as part of taking the Dodge action.
Additionally the Zhanhu may take the Dodge action as a bonus action on each of their turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Zhanhu makes two melee attacks with their changdao. They may replace one or more of these attacks with a grapple or shove.

action.name: Changdao
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Zhanhu adds 3 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them as a reaction. To do so, the Zhanhu must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reaction.name: Subduing Counterblow
entries: As a reaction to a creature attempting to make a melee attack against the Zhanhu after they have taken the dodge action on their turn, the Zhanhu may force them to make an opposed Dexterity check. If the Zhanhu succeeds they may make a single unarmed strike against the creature and the triggering attack is wasted; on a hit the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn. Otherwise the creature's attack happens normally.

entries.name: Special
entries: Donning or doffing this glove-like weapon requires an action and you may hold another object in the same hand as the cestus. Unarmed strikes deal {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage whilst the cestus is worn.

entries.name: Special
entries: When wielding this weapon you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action when you take the attack action.

entries.name: Special
entries: You require a Strength score of 15 or higher to use this weapon effectively, else your attacks have disadvantage.

entries.name: Special
entries: You require a Strength score of 17 or higher to use this weapon effectively, else your attacks have disadvantage.

entries.name: Special
entries: When wielded with one hand this weapon gains the finesse property.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} slashing damage at the start of their next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: Once per turn, when you hit with this weapon you can force the target to succeed a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: When you hit with an attack with this weapon, you can make another attack as a bonus action. However it deals {@damage 1d8} damage on a hit instead of {@damage 1d12}.

entries.name: Special
entries: Once per turn, you may make one of your attacks with this weapon a trap. If the attack misses you grapple the target and may immediately make a hilt spike attack with advantage against it. This attack deals {@damage 1d4} piercing damage on a hit.
However if the trapped attack hits, it deals no damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: This sickle-like weapon has a chain with a weight at the end. When you make a ranged attack by throwing the kusarigama you can pull the weapon back to your hand by the chain as part of the attack.

entries.name: Special
entries: Whilst wielding this weapon you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC against one melee attack that would hit you; to do so, you must see the attacker and be wielding the weapon.

entries.name: Special
entries: The scabbard of this sword may also be used as a weapon; when you are holding the shikomizue and its scabbard in each hand they are treated as light weapons. On a hit the scabbard deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: As a bonus action you can split the staff into two one-handed axe weapons that have the light property and deal {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a hit; the staff can be reconnected again as a bonus action.

baseitem.name: Macuahuitl
entries: A wooden club lined with prismatic blades of obsidian, capable of producing an edge sharper than high-quality steel razor blades, as such these weapons can cause serious lacerations.

entries.name: Special
entries: On a hit, this weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d4} slashing damage.

entries.name: Special
entries: You can draw and throw up to 2 kunai as part of an attack when you take the attack action; for each thrown above the first you add an additional damage die.

entries.name: Special
entries: You can draw and throw up to 3 shuriken as part of an attack when you take the attack action; for each thrown above the first you add an additional damage die.

entries.name: Special
entries: You can use a bonus action to steady yourself. While you are steadied, your attacks with the greatbow deal {@damage 2d6} piercing damage. You are no longer steadied if you move.

baseitem.name: Plated Chainmail
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings and segments of metal plate, plated chainmail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows with the metal plates worn over larger flat sections of the body. The suit includes gauntlets and greaves.

entries.name: Special
entries: When wearing this armor, you can add 1 to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 12 or higher.

baseitem.name: Segmented Plate
entries: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather along with a helmet, pauldrons, gauntlets and greaves. Although it leaves the joints relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered provided they are strong enough to manage its weight.

entries.name: Special
entries: When wearing this armor, you can add 3, rather than 2, to your AC if you have a Dexterity of 16 or higher.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 13, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

baseitem.name: Wooden Cuirass
entries: This armor consists of a fitted wooden chest piece worn with supple leather along with a helmet, pauldrons, gauntlets and greaves; with some variations featuring slats of wood used for reinforcement. Although it leaves the joints relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered thanks to the lightweight material.

baseitem.name: Metal Cuirass
entries: Metal cuirasses consist of several large shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It includes arm and leg protection consisting of metal vambraces and greaves that are attached with leather straps.

entries.name: Special
entries: If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 13, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

baseitem.name: Buckler
entries: A small shield about the size of a plate that is made from metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 1. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

entries.name: Special
entries: Whilst wielding this shield you are able to use two hands to attack with weapons that have the versatile property. Additionally you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC against one melee attack that would hit you; to do so, you must see the attacker and be wielding the buckler.

baseitem.name: Tower Shield
entries: A tall shield almost the size of a person that is made from strong wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

entries.name: Special
entries: Whilst wielding this shield, if you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.
Additionally if you move no more than half your movement speed on your turn, you count as being in half cover against ranged attacks whilst wielding this shield.
If the wearer has a Strength score lower than 15, their speed is reduced by 10 feet.

baseitem.name: Draconite Bolt
entries: A crossbow bolt made from a curious material with odd alchemical properties. Whenever you hit an object using this ammunition, each creature friendly to you within 30 feet of your attack's target regains {@dice 2d4} hitpoints.

item.name: Draconite Cleanser
entries: A bomb of odd alchemical origin. As an action, you can light and throw the bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency plus your Dexterity modifier) or take {@dice 3d4} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.
For 1 minute afterwards, each creature friendly to you within 10 feet of the chosen point at the start of their turn regains {@dice 1d4} hitpoints.

item.name: Fire Flask
entries: A simple glass flask containing a fiery, volatile liquid. You can throw the flask of flammable liquid at a point up to 60 feet away as an action on your turn. Each creature within 10 feet of the chosen point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency plus your Dexterity modifier) or take {@dice 5d4} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of your next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a DC 13 Dexterity save or take {@dice 3d6} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

item.name: Fire Trap
entries: A small portion of black powder surrounded by a flammable liquid with a pressure plate on top of the casing. You can set up the trap on the ground as an action. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 5d4} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried and lasts until the end of the triggering creature's next turn. A creature that enters the area during that time must make a DC 13 Dexterity save or take {@dice 3d6} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

item.name: Nail Bomb
entries: A small portion of black powder surrounded by many metal spikes with a pressure plate on top. You can set up the bomb on the ground as an action. A creature that steps on the plate and any others in a 5 foot radius must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 4d4} piercing damage.
Creatures that fail the Dexterity save take an additional {@dice 3d6} necrotic damage at the start of their next turn. On a successful save the damage is halved.

item.name: Pugno Mortis
entries: A crude black powder bomb. As an action, you can light and throw a black powder bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (with a DC equal to 8 plus your proficiency plus your Dexterity modifier) or take {@dice 3d6} fire damage. On a successful save the damage is halved.

item.name: Smoke Bomb
entries: A small orb designed to explode on impact and obscure a person's escape or creature confusion. As an action you can throw the smoke bomb at the floor, and on impact it emits a cloud of smoke that creates a heavily obscured area in a 10-foot radius. A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the smoke in 4 rounds; a strong wind (20 or more miles per hour) disperses it in 1 round.

item.name: Steel Plates
entries: A set of metal plates, such as arm and shin guards, designed to bolster the defence of lighter armors. If you wear these steel plates while wearing light armour or no armour, and using no shield, your AC increases by 1.

item.name: Death Whistle
entries: A small ceramic skull shaped whistle, capable of producing a chilling shrill sound akin to that of a dying shriek.

As an action you may blow the death whistle, each hostile creature that is within 30 feet of you and aware of you must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Death Whistle for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Hidden
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks to conceal this weapon.

entries.name: Monk Weapon
entries: A weapon with this property is included in the weapons that you can use with the Monk's Martial Arts feature and Monks are proficient with this weapon in addition to their other weapon proficiencies.
